full_summary:
# Road Analysis within the Proposed National Park Reserve

## Description
The government of Canada and British Columbia, along with the syilx (sm?lqmix and sukna?kinx)/Okanagan Nation, signed a Memorandum of Understanding in 2019 for a proposed national park reserve in the South Okanagan-Similkameen. This project protects rare ecosystems, contributes to the conservation and enjoyment of nature, and preserves opportunities for syilx/Okanagan Nation cultural practices.

## Requirement
Road analysis is required to support evidence-based dialogue on access management strategy and future planning for the proposed national park reserve.

## Scope of Work
• Conduct road analysis within the proposed national park reserve boundary
• Identify current roads, right-of-ways, and transportation corridors
• Determine the need for an access management strategy
• Identify gaps in knowledge of linear features within the proposed national park reserve

## Period of Contract
The contract period is from the date of contract to January 30, 2024, inclusive.

## Contact Information
- Name: Andrea McGraw-Alcock
- Email: andrea.mcgraw-alcock@pc.gc.ca
- Phone: (587) 436-5908
- Fax: 866-246-6893

## How to Bid
• Register for this bid solicitation on the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities
• Submit your bid electronically via email or fax
• Do not submit your bid in person or by courier
• Only email or fax submissions with attachments will be accepted

## Additional Information
• The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes
• Bidders are responsible for any errors due to transmission or receipt of the emailed bid due to file size
• National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act

## Notice
This bid solicitation can be accessed through the Government of Canada tendering service at the website above. Addenda, when issued, will be available from the same service. Bidders who elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk. Late submissions will not be considered.

The government department has provided notice through a publication date of 2023-07-11 and a tender closing date of 2023-09-12T16:
